verses.text: The wicked flee when no man pursueth : but the righteous are bold as a lion.

For the transgression of a land many \add are\add* the princes thereof: but by a man of understanding \add and\add* knowledge the state \add thereof\add* shall be prolonged.\f + \fr 28.2 \ft by…: or, by men of understanding and wisdom shall they likewise be prolonged\f*
A poor man that oppresseth the poor \add is like\add* a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.\f + \fr 28.3 \ft which…: Heb. without food\f*
They that forsake the law praise the wicked : but such as keep the law contend with them.
Evil men understand not judgment : but they that seek the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* understand all \add things\add*.
Better \add is\add* the poor that walketh in his uprightness , than \add he that is\add* perverse \add in his\add* ways , though he \add be\add* rich.
Whoso keepeth the law \add is\add* a wise son : but he that is a companion of riotous \add men\add* shameth his father.\f + \fr 28.7 \ft is a companion…: or, feedeth gluttons\f*
He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance , he shall gather it for him that will pity the poor.\f + \fr 28.8 \ft unjust…: Heb. by increase\f*
He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law , even his prayer \add shall be\add* abomination.
Whoso causeth the righteous to go astray in an evil way , he shall fall himself into his own pit : but the upright shall have good \add things\add* in possession.
The rich man \add is\add* wise in his own conceit ; but the poor that hath understanding searcheth him out.\f + \fr 28.11 \ft own…: Heb. eyes\f*
When righteous \add men\add* do rejoice , \add there is\add* great glory : but when the wicked rise , a man is hidden.\f + \fr 28.12 \ft hidden: or, sought for\f*
He that covereth his sins shall not prosper : but whoso confesseth and forsaketh \add them\add* shall have mercy.
Happy \add is\add* the man that feareth alway : but he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into mischief.
\add As\add* a roaring lion , and a ranging bear ; \add so is\add* a wicked ruler over the poor people.
The prince that wanteth understanding \add is\add* also a great oppressor : \add but\add* he that hateth covetousness shall prolong \add his\add* days.
A man that doeth violence to the blood of \add any\add* person shall flee to the pit ; let no man stay him.
Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved : but \add he that is\add* perverse \add in his\add* ways shall fall at once.
He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread : but he that followeth after vain \add persons\add* shall have poverty enough.
A faithful man shall abound with blessings : but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.\f + \fr 28.20 \ft innocent: or, unpunished\f*
To have respect of persons \add is\add* not good : for for a piece of bread \add that\add* man will transgress.
He that hasteth to be rich \add hath\add* an evil eye , and considereth not that poverty shall come upon him.\f + \fr 28.22 \ft hasteth…: or, hath and evil eye hasteth to be rich\f*
He that rebuketh a man afterwards shall find more favour than he that flattereth with the tongue.
Whoso robbeth his father or his mother , and saith , \add It is\add* no transgression ; the same \add is\add* the companion of a destroyer.\f + \fr 28.24 \ft a destroyer: Heb. a man destroying\f*
He that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife : but he that putteth his trust in the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall be made fat.
He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool : but whoso walketh wisely , he shall be delivered.
He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack : but he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.
When the wicked rise , men hide themselves: but when they perish , the righteous increase.
